summary: This bill, known as the Ellie Helton, Lisa Colagrossi, Kristen Shafer Englert, Teresa Anne Lawrence, and Jennifer Sedney Focused Research Act (or Ellie’s Law), aims to increase research on unruptured intracranial aneurysms. It highlights the prevalence and impact of these aneurysms, citing statistics on their occurrence, fatality rates, and costs. The bill authorizes appropriations of $10 million annually from 2026-2030 to the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke for research, focusing on a diverse patient population.
